trans-unit.source: Sets the bitmap or icon image to use for a control.

seg-source.mrk: Sets the bitmap or icon image to use for a control.

target.mrk: Sets the bitmap or icon image to use for a control.

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: The control identifier (controlID) as returned by a GUICtrlCreate...() function, or -1 for the last created control.

seg-source.mrk: The control identifier (controlID) as returned by a GUICtrlCreate...() function, or -1 for the last created control.

target.mrk: The control identifier (controlID) as returned by a GUICtrlCreate...() function, or -1 for the last created control.

trans-unit.source: The filename containing the picture to be display on the control.

seg-source.mrk: The filename containing the picture to be display on the control.

target.mrk: The filename containing the picture to be display on the control.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Icon name if the file contains multiple icons. Can be an ordinal name if negative number. Otherwise -1.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Icon name if the file contains multiple icons.
Can be an ordinal name if negative number.
Otherwise -1.

target.mrk: [optional]
Icon name if the file contains multiple icons.
Can be an ordinal name if negative number.
Otherwise -1.

trans-unit.source: [optional] To select a specific icon size : 0 = small, 1 = normal (default).

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
To select a specific icon size :
0 = small, 1 = normal (default).

target.mrk: [optional]
To select a specific icon size :
0 = small, 1 = normal (default).

trans-unit.source: For a TreeViewItem the icon size : 2 = selected, 4 for non-selected item.

seg-source.mrk: For a TreeViewItem the icon size :
2 = selected, 4 for non-selected item.

target.mrk: For a TreeViewItem the icon size :
2 = selected, 4 for non-selected item.

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: Use a resource hacker to know the value of the valid icon name in a file.

seg-source.mrk: Use a resource hacker to know the value of the valid icon name in a file.

target.mrk: Use a resource hacker to know the value of the valid icon name in a file.

trans-unit.source: If used on a Button control the image will be displayed on the button. Images can also be set for Checkbox controls as long as the $BS_PUSHLIKE style is used. In both case the $BS_ICON or $BS_BITMAP styles are needed to select the type of the picture used. The first icon resolution will be used in a multi icon resolution file. I.E. if a 128x128 is the first resolution and the control is 64x64 the image will be truncated.

seg-source.mrk: If used on a Button control the image will be displayed on the button.
Images can also be set for Checkbox controls as long as the $BS_PUSHLIKE style is used.
In both case the $BS_ICON or $BS_BITMAP styles are needed to select the type of the picture used.
The first icon resolution will be used in a multi icon resolution file.
I.E. if a 128x128 is the first resolution and the control is 64x64 the image will be truncated.

target.mrk: If used on a Button control the image will be displayed on the button.
Images can also be set for Checkbox controls as long as the $BS_PUSHLIKE style is used.
In both case the $BS_ICON or $BS_BITMAP styles are needed to select the type of the picture used.
The first icon resolution will be used in a multi icon resolution file.
I.E. if a 128x128 is the first resolution and the control is 64x64 the image will be truncated.

trans-unit.source: !!! If you use this command on a TreeViewItem the first time, then all other items will use this icon/image automatically by default !!!

seg-source.mrk: If you use this command on a TreeViewItem the first time, then all other items will use this icon/image automatically by default !!!

target.mrk: If you use this command on a TreeViewItem the first time, then all other items will use this icon/image automatically by default !!!

trans-unit.source: If you use GUICtrlSetImage() on a TreeView or ListView then all items of it will change to this icon/image.

seg-source.mrk: If you use GUICtrlSetImage() on a TreeView or ListView then all items of it will change to this icon/image.

target.mrk: If you use GUICtrlSetImage() on a TreeView or ListView then all items of it will change to this icon/image.

trans-unit.source: Passing a positive number will reference the string equivalent icon name.

seg-source.mrk: Passing a positive number will reference the string equivalent icon name.

target.mrk: Passing a positive number will reference the string equivalent icon name.

trans-unit.source: Passing a negative number causes 1-based "index" behaviour. Some Dll can have icon extracted just with negative numbers.

seg-source.mrk: Passing a negative number causes 1-based "index" behaviour.
Some Dll can have icon extracted just with negative numbers.

target.mrk: Passing a negative number causes 1-based "index" behaviour.
Some Dll can have icon extracted just with negative numbers.
